attributes.action: Hold a meaningful vote/referendum on the outcome of BREXIT negotiations
attributes.additional_details:
The response from the government RE petition - "Hold a referendum on the final Brexit deal" - was neither constructive or acceptable, it did not in anyway answer the question raised by the petition, instead we received a politically postured response, not a reply that actually took due care and attention of the question or point raised.

You need to actually understand what we are asking for, take it into proper consideration and thenreply in an understanding & acceptable manner.
attributes.background:
The gov response has not been acceptable/responsible concerning this matter.

We want you to hear us and let US have a say on the final BREXIT deal!

The British public should validate or veto what politicians have attempted to negotiate on our behalf if we deem it to be, or not be, good enough.

rejection.details:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/200004

While this petition is still open, we can't accept new petitions that ask for the same action. Petitions stay open for 6 months.
